question.title: Does Spring Cloud Kubernetes Config support local spring config while allowing overrides from ConfigMaps
question.body:
Edited:

I'm comparing Spring Cloud Config with Spring Cloud Kubernetes PropertySource of ConfigMaps. I've managed to do a quick POC with Spring Cloud Config, but I have not done a POC for the Spring Cloud Kubernetes. Both provide the ability to externalise your configuration.

Spring Cloud Config allows you to source your config in a mixed fashion, allowing Spring Cloud Config AND local spring config (and by that I mean regular spring config sourced off the classpath in files on local disk).

What is not 100% clear when reading the documentation of Spring Cloud Kubernetes PropertySource is whether it also supports the same ability to still source some config from local spring config. The documentation does not say either way; but reading all of Chapter 5 - it leads me to think you can't use local config; and the bootstrap process fully hands over sourcing all config from config maps.

It is also unclear how you would dev locally and easily make use of the config encoded in config maps.

Questions about using spring-cloud-kubernetes config maps as a property source:

  1. Does anyone have experience with this that could clarify if local config is supported?
  2. How you conveniently consume the same config when developing locally?
